model_purpose: The GNN file serves as a standard example for a comprehensive Partially Observable Markov Decision Process (POMDP) agent, designed to test GNN features, especially for parsing and rendering within the PyMDP framework.

state_factors.name: Location
state_factors.description: Represents different locations such as RoomA, RoomB, and Corridor.

state_factors.name: ResourceLevel
state_factors.description: Indicates the level of resources available, categorized as Low and High.

observation_modalities.name: VisualCue
observation_modalities.description: Includes observations like Door, Window, Food, and Empty.

observation_modalities.name: AuditorySignal
observation_modalities.description: Includes auditory observations such as Silence and Beep.

actions.name: Movement
actions.description: Actions related to movement, such as Stay, MoveClockwise, MoveCounterClockwise.

actions.name: Interaction
actions.description: Actions related to interaction with resources, including Wait and InteractWithResource.

expected_free_energy.description: Measures the overall expected utility of chosen policies.

priors.description: Initial beliefs about the state of the agent regarding its location and resource level.

potential_applications: Simulation of decision-making processes in partially observable environments.
Testing and validation of GNN parsing and rendering capabilities.
Development of adaptive agents that utilize active inference for state estimation and action selection.
limitations_or_ambiguities: The initial parameterization for A and B matrices is marked as placeholders due to complexities in parsing >2D arrays.
The model may require manual overrides or enhancements in the parser to handle complex data structures correctly.
Certain equations and dynamics are not fully elaborated, leading to potential ambiguities in implementation.

ontology_mapping_assessment.relevance: The ActInfOntology terms are present and relevant, providing a structured vocabulary for the model components, enhancing interpretability and integration with other systems.
